bayes

Class BNConditionalQuery

  • java.lang.Object
    • bayes.BNConditionalQuery

  • public class BNConditionalQuery
extends java.lang.Object
    Used for querying a BayesianNetwork object for a conditional probability of the value of a single attribute conditioned on the values of a set of other attributes. For example, if we wish to query a Bayes net for the following probability: P(A = a | E = e, D = d), this object would represent the query, (A = a | E = e, D = d)
    Author:
    Matthew Bernstein - matthewb@cs.wisc.edu

    • Field Detail

      • conditionVariables

        private VariableSet conditionVariables
        Each pair of integers represents an Attribute ID and the nominal value ID of the attribute. These pairs represent the values of specific attributes that the target attribute/value pair is conditioned on.

        For example, given the following query: P(A = a | D = d, E = e), this set of pairs would be as follows: (D,d), (E,e).

      • targetVariable

        private pair.Pair<Attribute,java.lang.Integer> targetVariable
        The target attribute value pair for which we would like to know the probability of observing.

        For example, given the following query: P(A = a | D = d, E = e), this pairs would be (A, a).

    • Constructor Detail

      • BNConditionalQuery

        public BNConditionalQuery()
        Constructor

    • Method Detail

      • addConditionVariable

        public void addConditionVariable(Attribute attr,
                        java.lang.Integer nomValueId)
        Add a condition attribute/value pair to the set of attribute/value pairs used in the query for finding the probability of finding the target attribute.
        Parameters:
        attr - the ID of the condition attribute to be added to the query
        nominalValueId - the nominal value ID specified for this Attribute

      • setTargetVariable

        public void setTargetVariable(Attribute attr,
                     java.lang.Integer nomValueId)
        Set the target variable for which this query wants to know the probability of observing. For example, if this query is of the following form: (A = a | B = b, E = e), then this method sets A = a
        Parameters:
        attr - the attribute of the target variable
        nomValueId - the value of the target variable

      • containsConditionAttribute

        public java.lang.Boolean containsConditionAttribute(Attribute attr)
        Determines whether this BNQuery includes the value of a specific attribute in the set of condition attributes
        Parameters:
        attr - the target Attribute
        Returns:
        true if this query is specifying a value for this specific Attribute in the set of condition attributes

      • getValueForConditionAttribute

        public java.lang.Integer getValueForConditionAttribute(Attribute attr)
        Gets the value for a specific attribute in the set of condition attributes. If this attribute is not specified by this query, this method returns null.
        Parameters:
        attr - the target Attribute
        Returns:
        the value of target Attribute specified in the condition part of the query. null if this Attribute is not specified in this query

      • getConditionVariableList

        public java.util.ArrayList<pair.Pair<Attribute,java.lang.Integer>> getConditionVariableList()
        Returns:
        the list of attribute/value pairs in the set of condition variables specified in this query. Each pair is the ID of the attribute and the nominal value ID of the value of this attribute. If this query represents (A = a | E = e, D = d), this method returns ((E,e), (D,d))

      • getConditionalVariableSet

        public VariableSet getConditionalVariableSet()
        Returns:
        the list of attribute/value pairs in the set of condition variables specified in this query. Each pair is the ID of the attribute and the nominal value ID of the value of this attribute. If this query represents (A = a | E = e, D = d), this method returns ((E,e), (D,d))

      • getTargetVariable

        public pair.Pair<Attribute,java.lang.Integer> getTargetVariable()
        Returns:
        the target attribute/value pair specified in this conditional probability query. If this query represents (A = a | E = e, D = d), this method returns (A,a)

      • getAllVariableSet

        public VariableSet getAllVariableSet()
        Returns:
        the list of attribute/value pairs in this query including the target variable. Each pair is the ID of the attribute and the nominal value ID of the value of this attribute. If this query represents (A = a | E = e, D = d), this method returns ((A,a), (E,e), (D,d))

      • getAllVariableList

        public java.util.ArrayList<pair.Pair<Attribute,java.lang.Integer>> getAllVariableList()
        Returns:
        the list of attribute/value pairs in this query including the target variable. Each pair is the ID of the attribute and the nominal value ID of the value of this attribute. If this query represents (A = a | E = e, D = d), this method returns ((A,a), (E,e), (D,d))
